NCBW1wpzUJUQzQYqdnO3.description:
## ++Objective:++

This requirement captures the v2 functionality for our slack application, to be pushed to the app store.

​

Version 2 will enable existing Tara users and teams to:

​

1. Activate a host of /commands:


- `/tara help`
- `/tara add [title]` (released)
- `/tara set [slug] [field] [value]` (released)
- Note: available fields: title (text), description (text), effort (number), status (case- and space-insensitive variations of todo/done/doing), assignee (name selected from from dropdown after typing @), collaborators (similar as assignee, but can be more than 1 name), sprint (text), requirement (text)

​

1. Adding tasks: add new tasks using a series of /commands starting with `/tara add [title]`, or using a modal that activates with `/tara add.`

​

1. When a link to a task is posted, action buttons are displayed. One button leads to the task in Tara, while the other ("Edit") is a shortcut to a task modal opening in slack. Task is editable from this modal.

​

1. Notifications:


- generating sprint completion report for a channel at the end of a sprint.
- activate @mention notifications on slack for mentions in requirements and tasks. (released)

​

1. Create a task from message actions menu

​

1. Url unfurling should now work in private/public channels and ++direct messages++

​

_7. For consideration: will a user have the ability to connect their individual slack profile to multiple Tara workspaces? Or is it one user profile, per workspace? Need to determine the relationship here._

​

​

## ++Planned:++

Start research: Oct 19th

Prepare app store submission: Nov 2nd

Nov 16th to 30th: roll out features for v2

Nov 27th: 2nd app store submission

​

With the Tara Slack app, users should be able to:

​

- Mention TASK-2239 by name and a preview shows up with actions.

​

NOTE: TO BE UPDATED, LATEST SPECS HERE: **https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Slack-App--A~Zgs9Gv~ztTl7HJhig9jrG5Ag-Zk0nDE9qyA8REtkDB7DGu**

​

## ++/commands:++

- /tara add - invokes a modal that allows the user to add attributes to the task
- "Help" if you DM Tara App and /tara help if you are inside a channel or elsewhere
- /tara feedback [Enter feedback here]. _This sends app feedback directly to an email or some form of collection method to view feedback from a user. [low priority]_

​

​

## ++Task creation and actions:++

- Add new Tara tasks to sprint boards directly from Slack with /tara add. The tasks should get added to their default primary workspace. User will have several options to add or edit tasks via commands, modal or shortcut in task preview.

 > This means we need a slack icon to indicate task source in the task modal. [See here](https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/tasks/790).

 > Once a task is "created", user should also be able to update effort, assignee and mark in a sprint from slack itself. This can be either through the modal window or through a long series of a slack command.

​

_User Option A: /commands for task updating ie __**/tara add [collaborators] [task name]**__\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

​

Note: The commands below will update the last task expanded in the channel

 > **Assign teammates to a task**

 > Example: **/tara assign @aleks**

 > **Add a comment to a task**

 > Example: **/tara comment Awesome work!**

 > **Add or update the sprint on a task**

 > Example: **/tara sprint 20**

​

_User Option B: Shortcuts under task preview, which lead to a task modal window inside slack._

​

Once new task is created- the below visual interface pulls up after /tara add [task name]

​

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Frequirements%2FNCBW1wpzUJUQzQYqdnO3%2FScreen%20Shot%202020-11-04%20at%2011.30.32%20AM-a59dd0fc-59c7-47f7-85d8-69e49a6b4f68?alt=media&token=c8b7455a-0360-4956-b89b-7f92ca854669)

​

​

_User Option C: Modal Window opens with the command /tara add. _[Designs here](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5f8dbfcc26d46e60137620ec/screen/5fa2ff805f96c602cc69aa1a)_**.**_

​

@tara-user-mIvZTMz0UedxYsqukJFtlw7csBy2_ Just need to decide if we\'re going with the long or short modal._

​

_Fields for Modal:_

​

_**Edit Task - 1234**_

_**Possible expansion panel**_

​

1. Title
2. Status (optional)
3. Assignee (optional)
4. Description (optional)
5. Sprint (optional)
6. Requirement (optional)
7. Effort (unit) (optional)

​

​

## ++@ mentions:++

- When a given user is mentioned in a requirement, task or comment with the @ mention indication, the Tara app sends a direct message to the individual mentioned
- [Design here.](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5f8dbfcc26d46e60137620ec/screen/5f737ed8a0570c34b51e9158) @tara-user-tj2iV4i7qccYaKPeyTKwrKB7pJT2

​

​

## ++Invite flows:++

- On app home send hello message + include info to integrate account [https://api.slack.com/surfaces/tabs/events](https://api.slack.com/surfaces/tabs/events) (if not already integrated). [Design here](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5f8dbfcc26d46e60137620ec/screen/5fa337f5d97fe68fb253af55) does not take current copy into account.
- [Assign task flow when user is already on Tara.](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5f8dbfcc26d46e60137620ec/screen/5f8f7b33729d1abf5256be3f)
- [Assign task flow when user is not already on Tara](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5f8dbfcc26d46e60137620ec/screen/5fa72306edbfeb51c051aa84) (will require notification to alert user to sign up on Tara).

​

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Frequirements%2FNCBW1wpzUJUQzQYqdnO3%2Fimage-ff9a14fd-9b56-4658-bd0e-d62cf417e70b?alt=media&token=5ce5be54-df4d-4c7f-ab75-0c976ec86372)

​

​

​

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Frequirements%2FNCBW1wpzUJUQzQYqdnO3%2Fimage-c129e295-6d35-48e7-a1a3-8f2aa3f1e4e6?alt=media&token=d2cf3bec-7dce-40bc-8975-a316aec22e95)

​

​

​

​

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Frequirements%2FNCBW1wpzUJUQzQYqdnO3%2Fimage-7d977d40-9f78-422a-b7d6-485e5716cdd0?alt=media&token=65c5341b-3d80-4f1c-9584-959f987c3caa)

​

​

## ++Notifications ++

_Categories of notifications on Tara:_

_Public or private channel, (channel) vs private notifications (App DM)_

​

_Sprints:_

- When a sprint is completed (channel): send notification on PRs, commits, tasks and effort completed.

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Frequirements%2FNCBW1wpzUJUQzQYqdnO3%2Fimage-40372743-c671-4243-82b1-e826bf25d055?alt=media&token=79bf67b1-0612-484e-8c09-b02ad2e5de7d)

​

​

_++Reporting:++_

 > Add notification for "sprint complete" stats -> channel notification (reporting)

​

​

## ++Converting any message to a task (Optional)++

​

Optional and discussion required. B2 global shortcut would allow the user to convert any message on slack, into a task on Tara (or attach to a task on Tara). This would be really useful when posting issues/bugs on slack (which we already do).

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Frequirements%2FNCBW1wpzUJUQzQYqdnO3%2Fimage-74a3554f-2f7c-4147-8db1-f82a24ed5ee9?alt=media&token=62653144-cd5e-44dc-b407-dcb16c694977)

​

## ++Unfurling in direct messages ++(DONE)

_Once Tara is added to a workspace, users should be able to unfurl a task when direct messaging each other and in group chats of 2 or more individuals when discussing a certain task._

​

​

NfhOxdrK0FwemoLkgxhf.description:
https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Commenting--A3YhN\_lvd\_\_fcRD3yrFMv0DAAQ-RqfNKDK1pEUlGCx2OBrW5

# Task Commenting

Designs: https://zpl.io/2vJ3ewY

​

## Implementation Summary on a 2 week timeline:

- ~~Using Draft Inline Editor~~
- Multi Line Comments. Submit on Enter
- ~~Delete comments~~
- Support for Links in comments
- Support for Inline Images in comments
- Email Notification for all users in a comment thread
- ~~Load on Demand for the initial implementation~~
- Revise all our existing listeners

​

_**Next?**_

- Comment Editing?
- Emoji support?
- Comment threading?
- In App & Web Notifications?
- Pre-Load?

​

# Frontend

- ~~Draft View version for showing comments~~
- ~~Draft Editor with shift-enter for adding comments, enter to send~~

​

# Database structure

Comments are stored as a sub-collection of `tasks` collection: `orgs/${orgId}/tasks/${taskId}/comments/${commentId}`

## Document Data:

- organizationId: string (todo: double check if Firestore allows to limit collectionGroup queries to some parent document before adding this attribute)
- authorId: string
- createdAt: Timestamp
- deletedAt: Timestamp | null
- description: string (in Markdown format)
- mentionedUserIds: string[]
- parentId: string | null
- hasThread: boolean

​

# Notifications

## Emails

A cloud function is triggered on comment create action.

Assignee, collaborator and all thread participants (including mentioned users) receive an email.

## Other

Later we might want to implement other notification systems. All of them can work in a similar way - trigger cloud function on comment creation and send notification from the backend.

# @Jess:

- Ask if comments should be single or multi-line `(multi-line, shift+enter to go second line -from jess)`
- Comment Toggle Button to hide bar, click to open and close any time; by default when there are no comments the comments are hidden `(no toggle button -from jess)`
- Template for emails and notifications
- Potential in app notification indicators
- Centering the task modal and have the comment sidebar on the side

PEXZYvFAK2OsJyNNmgCv.description:
Figma link: [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1349%3A11521](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1349%3A11521)

## General logic

- Everything should be behind a 3.0 feature flag. Do not delete any existing functionality. Do not change any existing functionality. We will be supporting both versions of the app until the 3.0 work is complete.
- The Create Task box & Backlog filter sticks to the top. The rest of the work drawer will scroll.

​

## Backlog Filter

**1. Team/me toggle**

1a. Team is the default selection.

1b. The backlog team/me toggle is a ephemal filter (meaning on page refresh is goes back to "team").

1c. The team/me toggle only for the work drawer. Nothing else on the page.

1d. Toggling to me will hide all tasks in the work drawer that are not assignee or collaborator by the user.

-- ideally this is a Redux slice.

​

​

## Create Task Box

**1.Character counter**

1a. Character counter will update on keyup

1b. Character counter will not include any charaters from a plugin (assignee, label, estamation)

**2. The input box will use DraftJS**

2a. DraftJS will have 3 plugins enabled: assignee, labels & estimation (new plugin).

2b. Standard plugin functionality will work. ex: when a user types the "@" it will open the typeahead to select a user.

2c. All 3 plugins will show in the create task box but once the task is added the task.title field will not show any assignees, nor estimate. Those will be saved on the proper fields.

**3. Keyboard**:

3a. Hitting the Enter key will create the task.

3b. Assignee and estimtation will not be saved in the task.title but in the proper fields

**4. Plugins**

4a. Estimation plugin: Only the first \`+\d\` will be the estimation. Any other +\d will just be text in the description

4b. Assignee plugin: The first "@" person in the task will be the assignee. Any other "@" names will be added as collaborators.

4c. Labels will function exactly like they do currently.

4d. Label styles will all be just blue text with no background.

​

## Estimation plugin

**1. General - **[**https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement/hOVVIPAo5BPYqDzQoVRR**](https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement/hOVVIPAo5BPYqDzQoVRR)

1a. The \`+n\` estimate should be an additional plugin but only used on this specific component. It should not be used in other draft editor instances. When a user types + followed by a number it will create the task with that estimate but not include it in the task description.

1b. There is no special indication or styling when a user types + and a number. But it will be removed from the task title and added as an estimate to the task. 

​

​

## 1st Tier Accordion - Tasks, Requirements, Repos, Imports

**1. Sections.**

1a. Opening a section will only open one level down.

1b. ++Egnieering Requirement.++ Do not load tasks for a section until it\'s opened.

1c. One page load all sections will only have the second level open. That means it will show all orphanes tasks, requirements and git repos but none of the 3rd level task cards.

1d. All sections have an empty state. [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1678%3A79690](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1678%3A79690)

1e. All tasks (completed + uncompleted) will be loaded. For Requirements all unachieved will be loaded.

**2. Task section**

2a. Task section will not have a + button and will not have any 2nd Teir accoridon components, just task cards.

**3. Requirement Section**

3a. Clicking the plus will add a Teir 2 row in an edit state to add a new requirement title.

3b. When a requirment is opened but has 0 tasks it will have an inline create task box.

**4. Repo section**

4a. Repo section will list the name of the github/gitlab repos, if attached to their workspace.

4b. Clicking on the repo empty state will open the integration page.

4c. Clicking the plus will open the integration page.

**5. Import section**

5a. Clicking the import empty state will open the popup to import a CSV.

5b. Clicking the import empty state will open the popup to import a CSV.

5c. When tasks are all created from an import a green toast at the bottom of the work drawer will say they are all imported.

Empty States: [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1678%3A79690](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1678%3A79690)

1. Sticky Headers

6a. All Tier 1 sections will be sticky in browsers that support CSS position: sticky

6b. If the browser doesn\'t support position sticky then we do nothing

6c. Sticky header must be stacked under the create task box. Tasks section will stick to 0px, Requirements will stick at 30px, Repos will stick at 60px & Imports will stick at 90px.

​

Q: TBD --- Task filtering. Tasks will only be show that have NOT been completed.

​

## 2nd Teir Accordion - Requirement

**1. Default mode.**

1a. Clicking toggles the open/closed state.

1b. When closed it should show a count of the total tasks for a requirement.

1c. When expanded the count should hide and all 3rd Tier task cards should be shown.

1d. Tier 2 can NOT be dragged or ordered. Tier cards can be dropped on to Tier 2 and will be added to the bottom of the list.

1e. When Tier 2 is open Tier 3 cards can be dropped in order and the custom order will be saved in Firestore.

1f. When a Tier 3 card is dragged to a sprint it will still show up in under the Tier 2 in the work drawer and also on the sprint column.

**2. Creation mode.**

2a. Only requirements section Teir 2 have a creation mode,

2b. Clicking the plus in the requirement Tier 1 will create a new Tier 2 row at the top. The keyboard should be auto-focused on the new input field

2c. Hitting enter on when in the teir 2 input field will create a requirement.

2d. The Requirement title field is plain text only. It does not use DraftJS.

**3. Sort**

3a. For the initial release there is no custom dragging/sorting on requirements. Requirements are sorted by creation date.

\* ++**Engineering Note**++: To load tasks for the work drawer. We should decide if there should be one query that loads and gets updated when a 2nd teir is opened or if to use multiple queries for each section. Let\'s consider performance first over code design on this.

**4. Repo & Import Tier 2.**

4a. When a repo or import is in progress of importing tasks it will have a loading icon and a special onHover state to let users know it\'s loading.

4b. Imports and repos are ordered alphabetically.

**5. Empty State **- [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1690%3A0](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1690%3A0)

​

Q: TBD - do we display all tasks for a requirement or only non-completed tasks?

Q: Do new requirements w/o tasks have a special state?

​

​

++**Out of scope:**++

- Requirements are not draggable. They will be ordered by creation date.
- Add new requirement is NOT deletable/cancelable. If the user clicks out of the create new requirement input box it will stay until the page is changed.

## Task Card

**0. Engineering Deprecation notice.**

0a. This will deprecate the existing feature card. Please rename the existing FeatureCard to LegacyFeatureCard but leave it in the app. We must support the existing version of the app while we build the new version.

**1. Drag and Drop**

1a. Do NOT support DnD for this initial work. Wait until Vijay is done with beautiful DnD first and then we will add DnD support to the work drawer.

**2. Estimate/Status circle states**

2a. Estimate/status circle will be grey if the card is NOT in the current sprint.

2b. If the card is in the current sprint the background color of the circle reflects the status. yellow=todo, blue=doing, green=done @see [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=622%3A0](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=622%3A0)

**3. Background color states**

3a. When a card is in a sprint and the sprint is overloaded the background color will change. @see [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=622%3A0](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=622%3A0)

**4. Text**

4a. The text should NOT use DraftJS. The text is not editable inline.

4b. Any labels in the task.title will be clickable and highlighted in blue. Clicking a label will replace the page-level Redux slice to all items that contain that label. Do NOT compose multiple filters together; We only support one label filter at a time.

4c. Any word that is TASK-/d will be in blue and will be clickable. Clicking will replace the page-level filter reducer.

4d. When a task card is in the work drawer and theuser hovers over it and it\'s in a sprint it will display a tooltip saying what sprint it\'s in.

**5. Editing a card.**

5a. This is out of scope. It will be done later.

**6. Labels**

6a. All label types will have the same style. Labels will have **blue text with no background**.

6b. Clicking a label will override the page-level filter to have just that one Label.

6c. Labels are NOT editable. There is no pop-up or hover state.

​

++**Out of Scope**++

• Do NOT support DnD at all until Vijay\'s work is shipped to production!!

• For the intial release clicking on a card does not do anything. We will remove the UI hover state that says it will move to the current sprint.

• Editing a task is out of scope. It will be added after the task side panel is built. Until then only connect it to the current task modal screen.

\* Inline editing of title or estimate is out of scope.

• Clicking anywhere on the card will only open the task modal. Once the task side panel is finished, clicking the card will update the side panel instead.

• Label are NOT editable.

​

## Task Info Tool Tip

1. Hovering over a task in the work drawer that has a non-null sprint set will display a tool tip.
2. The tool tip will do nothing execpt show/hide on hover.
3. clicking the task will NOT doing anything,

++**Out of scope**++

- click the tool tip is out of scope. It\'s just a onHover show/hide

​

​

## ++Out of Scope++

- Do not support drag and drop. Vijay is working on wrapping up the new Beautiful DnD library. That library is manditory for the 3.0 version. We will add it once Vijay\'s work is done.
- Keyboard shortcuts are out of scope! The one execption ishitting enter when in the create task box.

S6Zgq0tLoxMja9FfkDyA.description:
Overview
--------

We are adding user invitation in the app so that any user can invite others to his/her org.

Important Note
--------------

We will break this into two iterations.

1.  First Iteration: we will only allow invitation of users that have emails of the same domain that are tied to a particular org. That means when an org is tied to, for example, facebook.com, then the users invited must have the email with the @facebook.com domain. Since we already have that capability, we\'d only need to send that invitees a generic link for them to sign up.
2.  Second iteration: allow the invitation of users with other domains. For example, john@facebook.com can invite jane@gmail.com to join Facebook\'s org.

Notes
-----

*   User should be able to join an org automatically when invited via an email link - no need to explicitly join org.
*   When an invitee clicks on the invite link, that invitee is redirected to the user to sign up page
*   If the user goes to generic sign up at app.tara.ai without going through the invite link, then the user can only join the org if there is a domain match \[first iteration\] or if the user\'s email is on the invite collection (i.e. that email has previously been sent an email invite.) \[second iteration\]
*   Add resend invitation button to the invited user list
*   max number of characters in the custom invite message (in the popup) = 1000 characters
*   email addresses must be valid
*   Any user can invite other users (i.e. no need to have admin role)
*   Only Tara employees can create new orgs, and so orgs need to be created first before external users can join them.

Design - invitation popup: [https://zpl.io/bejkZ0q](https://zpl.io/bejkZ0q) and [https://zpl.io/VQdXlvk](https://zpl.io/VQdXlvk)[](https://zpl.io/bejkZ0q)

Design - User list of invitees: [https://zpl.io/awgdJA7](https://zpl.io/awgdJA7)[](https://zpl.io/bejkZ0q)
S6Zgq0tLoxMja9FfkDyA.title: User invitation and joining org flows

In order to keep users engaged on the platform and provide valuable information to users on their journey when using the platform, we need to be able to send some emails out to them based on actions performed. The key actions that we want to send data for is:

​

- First Task Created: Date of First Task Created
- No of Sprints Created
- No of Tasks Created
- No of Workspaces
- First sprint Completed: Boolean (True or False)
- No of teams created per workspace
- No of sprints completed per workspace

​

More information on the triggers can be found here [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1e2lucvg53BebLBWHCTg4PIktRHkpjm7VFoT39jZ\_8zI/edit#gid=0](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1e2lucvg53BebLBWHCTg4PIktRHkpjm7VFoT39jZ_8zI/edit#gid=0)

Txazq4GEwAztqmYaiR9M.description:
@tara-user-o4yyzJztJzg546ggMrWBjMX2dyw2 Is it safe to say that this requirement can be archived.  I\'m doing both QA _and_ trying to clean up the board so everyone is crystal clear on what we should be focused on. Thank you!

cisco

​

​

​

**Problem:**

​

Users on the platform tend to forget to either start a sprint or complete a sprint. Even with the pulsing green button, the tendency for the user to realize in time that a sprint has ended or needs to be started is low. This in turn results in empty states showing up for the home page, wrong sprint time frame on the sprint planning page and also no progress on the sprint timeline when a sprint is completed.

​

**Solution**

​

The solution is to have a rolling sprint that is always active. From the time the user signs up for the first time, there is an active sprint for them to start work on. For existing users we would simply roll over the their sprints automatically based on the duration they\'ve set.

​

**What does this solve for first time users:**

First time signed up users will have a populated home screen when they create tasks in a sprint, they will also see these directly visible on the sprint timeline. It will educate the user faster and decrease our time to value.

​

**What does this solve for current users:**

Users that forget to start or complete sprints frequently will have one less interaction to worry about. We want sprints to be a set and forget process.

​

**User Flow for New Users:**

​

1. **User signs up for Tara**
2. Proceeds through onboarding
3. After finishing onboarding the user is then introduced to **new sprint settings** by the product tour from intercom, we also let the user know the sprints are now on auto pilot and they can change defaults easily

​

**User flow for existing users**

1. **For existing users we use a separate tour through intercom that highlights the new sprint settings**
2. We make it obvious to the user that the sprints are now on autopilot and can be changed through the settings page
3. Existing users settings are passed on and if the user has a) not started a new sprint or b) not completed their sprint on the day we release the feature, it will be auto started for them with a default start day of Monday.

​

​

**How will Sprint Auto Start/Complete Work**

​

By default for all users the sprint will start on Monday 12:00 am and Complete automatically on Sunday 11.59 am. For existing users this will take their current duration into account. All Sprint Cycles must be in weeks i.e 7,14,21 days.

​

The new sprint settings will have the following configurable fields:

- Sprint Duration (1 and 2 Weeks)
- Sprint Name (default name will be autofilled as Sprint 1) <--- [ @tara-user-o4yyzJztJzg546ggMrWBjMX2dyw2, a new user creates a new workspace, is "Sprint 1" already active? Also it seems like we need a similar flow for newly created teams within an existing workspace as well.]
- Sprint Start Day (if the sprint start day is lets say Tuesday with a duration of 2 weeks then the sprint complete day is automatically set on the backend as Monday 11.59pm on day 14) <--- [ @tara-user-o4yyzJztJzg546ggMrWBjMX2dyw2, I\'d suggest specifying time zone/UTC time or something. ]
- "Carry my tasks over to next Sprint on Completion" Checkbox
- Save settings button

​

**Discussion**

​

Q: I\'d suggest specifying time zone/UTC time or something?

A: Do we want that in a more digestible format in a dropdown like {UTC +8 Los Angeles, etc) or a a more precise time and date input @tara-user-U254wzKSYUUS8mQ4V2H2sdYnp603 A dropdown works. Alternatively, we don\'t need to let user choose necessarily... Perhaps we can be explicit about the time zone on the screen so that there\'s no ambiguity for the team (especially if the team is cross-time zones like us) @tara-user-o4yyzJztJzg546ggMrWBjMX2dyw2

​

Q: a new user creates a new workspace, is "Sprint 1" already active? Also it seems like we need a similar flow for newly created teams within an existing workspace as well.

A: I agree I can set a task in UX improvements to handle that @tara-user-U254wzKSYUUS8mQ4V2H2sdYnp603

​

IP to timezone service to set a default timezone: [maxmind/geoip2-node](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@maxmind/geoip2-node) It\'s a free version of Maxmind\'s product that supports ip->timezone lookup. Let\'s just use the REST version and not the offline DB.

​

https://maxmind.github.io/GeoIP2-node/interfaces/locationrecord.html#timezone

​

​

https://xd.adobe.com/view/8a9512e9-f3d9-4c14-8760-0ab86477278b-dfc6/

​

UOBxKionhX7CUsMKvZT2.title: Sprint Summary Email
UOBxKionhX7CUsMKvZT2.description:
**Problem: **Users who complete a sprint tend to overlook their sprint stats that are hidden away in the sprint details page history. The sprint summary email will show some basic stats and tasks that moved over.


**Solution: **The sprint summary email that is trigger **per workspace per user** when their sprints complete every week or every other week. The email is triggered when the user clicks on complete on their sprint. If the user is a part of multiple teams, we will append a second section underneath with stats for the second team. Example of this can be found [here in figma](https://www.figma.com/file/6YWjyEGNroaTMpACrpxdVW/Tara-Others?node-id=14%3A0)

[
](https://www.figma.com/file/6YWjyEGNroaTMpACrpxdVW/Tara-Others?node-id=14%3A0)**Link to the email template: https://down2thepixel.com/tara/**


**Fields that email template will need populated:**

- Workspace Name

- Team Name

- Sprint Number

- Total Effort Completed

- Total Tasks Done

- Requirements Created during the sprint per Team

- PR\'s Closed during the sprint 

- Tasks Recently Assigned to the user

- Tasks the user completed in this sprint

UxiRCUMAOflZuz8DyxX6.description:
Feature Branch: `feature/charlie-delta/multi-team`

​

Environment: `tara-cloud-feature` - Created by Aleks and Mateusz

​

VR3Cz8ZuEEjbrIQCRPCy.author: LCu96CcgYjQz7tEYOi5J1CfMwIv2
VR3Cz8ZuEEjbrIQCRPCy.description:
**Background**

After Multi-Team initial rollout, there are some features per the original spec that were not yet implemented. Some of these are crucial to making multi-team feature functioning properly. Here, we capture the requirements for those “enhancements”.

Background slide: [link](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1nGDz7R7Oj7ppZVAzCtNp45lzkKy6-JLnNAPwRbkJnp0/edit#slide=id.ga1582ba9b6_1_6)

​

**Requirements in priority order:**

A. ++Assigning requirement to teams++ - [design](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5e9a23cbff46857f3ce36ae3/screen/5e9a251e6247cb788dcab2d8):

- User can select to which team(s) to assign to a requirement.
- Only show requirement on the teams’ backlogs when it’s assigned to those teams
- When there’s no team assigned to a requirement, it is considered to be in “draft” mode; won’t show in any backlog
- Migration: existing active requirements will be assigned to all teams of a workspace

B. ++Requirement List shows team column++ - [design](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5e9a23cbff46857f3ce36ae3/screen/5e9e2b14854bde7b340b4551):

- Show team assignment column on requirement list
- Enable filtering by team on requirement list table

​

End Of Phase 1 -------

​

C. ++Show product tour on Sprint Backlog++ - [design for reference](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5e9a23cbff46857f3ce36ae3/screen/5ea36f9ce1344bbac89f1f68):

- Show a pop-up letting users know about new team’s assignment for requirement and its impact on backlog (See design for reference, but perhaps use Intercom instead)

D. ++Slack notification update++

- Instead of notification on every requirement creation, should only notify when a requirement is assigned to team, and only to those team members

D. ++Hide “my teams” from “all teams” in team switcher++

- Right now the list of “my teams” are replicated in “all teams”. They shouldn’t be duplicated.

E. ++Last team message++

- When user tries to leave the last team of which s/he is a member

F. ++Team deletion++ - [https://zpl.io/VY3d3xk](https://zpl.io/VY3d3xk), [https://zpl.io/anw0kZl](https://zpl.io/anw0kZl)

- Delete function only available when there are no active or completed sprints for that team
- If there are upcoming sprints, move those tasks back to the backlog

​

## **Questions:**

1. @tara-user-QB1THhILsuV7e2JqXXPhgmALjU82 are we using the new styles for Team selector UI component

WGJXSnnJSO9AaE8XVnZa.author: RNq9L6ObY4dypHK1IdUeNm3TOTx1
WGJXSnnJSO9AaE8XVnZa.title: Sprint details with Git status
WGJXSnnJSO9AaE8XVnZa.description:
Designs:

[https://app.zeplin.io/project/5d82bd8c15ade554f8e9e1c2/screen/5f7507a44e969c459f2613c5](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5d82bd8c15ade554f8e9e1c2/screen/5f7507a44e969c459f2613c5)

​

The original spec task: https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/tasks/2402

​

## **Requirement:**

We should be able to display a status for each task that has a Git data connected to it. This status consists of:

- Commits count - number
- PR state: \'PR conflicts\' | \'Merge blocked\' | \'PR pending\' | \'Merge ready\' | \'Merged\'

​

Additionally the task status should be automatically set to \'Done\' when the \'PR state\' is \'Merged\' .

​

## **Implementation considerations:**

Currently we don’t differentiate between ‘closed’ and ‘merged’ states for PRs. And also there are some service specific limitations:

​

**Github:**
There are still two cases for which the mergeableState won’t be updated correctly:
\* Merge conflicts (we’re waiting for Cloud Tasks infrastructure to be in place)
\* CI checks failed (not implemented yet)

​

**Gitlab:**
We only have access to the information whether the PR is open or closed. No mergeableState available yet, it will always show unknown.
This information could be obtained from Gitlab API (possibly in a less detailed form than in Github). We should research what\'s possible to obtain form webhooks.

​

## **Implementation V1:**

First iteration would only include the following PR states:

- Github: \`${num} commits\` | ‘PR pending’ | ‘PR blocked’ | ‘Merged’
- Gitlab: ‘MR pending’ | ‘Merged’

​

Mapping:

​

\'PR Pending\' == \'pending\' |

\'PR Blocked\' == \'blocked\'

\'Merged\' == \'merged\'

​

...and switching the task status.

​

## **Out of scope until V2:**

The following PR states are out of scope until V2:

- \`CI Failed\` status
- Gitlab feature parity
- auto-changing task status based on source control

​

​

​

XUwg9ckgdcvCN91vslii.description:
Problem: Currently the sprint progress page shows all tasks and their progress in a flat, unfilterable list. It makes it hard for users to see progress on both the requirement level and user level.

​

Solution: Add a filter system that shows progress by People OR Requirement as well as People AND Requirements. This is acheived by using a single select dropdown.

​

Designs (Inactive Filter): [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5dc457eace302d23dce64377/screen/5e4dc84cb16dcb7b47b4e1c5](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5dc457eace302d23dce64377/screen/5e4dc84cb16dcb7b47b4e1c5)

Designs (Filter Active): [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5dc457eace302d23dce64377/screen/5e4dc84bdafb167fc78caabd](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5dc457eace302d23dce64377/screen/5e4dc84bdafb167fc78caabd)

Note 03/15/2021: As discussed with Syed, **these designs are not relevant**. Filters should be implemented as on the screenshot attached.

​

Functional Aspects:

- Since we now have the team switcher on the Sprint Progress Page, these filters should reflect only the users in that selected team and the requirements assigned to that team. So assuming the user as Alpha Pod selected, then only the requirements for Alpha Pod and the Users for Alpha pod are available as options in the filter.
- You can only filter by a single requirement and a single user.
- The filter drop downs do not have multi-selects.
- When a user filter is active, it is highlighted in blue and displays the name and avatar of the user
- When a requirement filter is active, it is highlighted in blue and displays name of the requirement, please ensure there is a label on hover to display the full title of the requirement if the title does not completely show when selected as a filter

​

Enhancements: 

​

- When a filter is active, show its selection in the dropdown when its **closed**. So assume a user selected the requirement name "Gitlab CI Integration" from the filter and then clicks outside or closes the dropdown. The selected filtered requirement shows in filter box like in this design [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5dc457eace302d23dce64377/screen/5e4dc84bdafb167fc78caabd](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5dc457eace302d23dce64377/screen/5e4dc84bdafb167fc78caabd)
- Show Requirements in Filter by selected Team. So if Bravo pod has 4 assigned requirements only show those 4 in the dropdown filter selection
- Show Users in Filter by Selected Team. So lets Assume the Bravo Pod has 3 users, then show only those 3 users in that filter selection
- Adjust drop down filter font sizes

​

Acceptance Criteria:

- A user should be able to filter their sprint by Requirement or User based on the team thats selected in the Progress View. So if a user is actively on Charlie Pod and viewing their Progress, then they can only filter by the users in their team and the requirements assigned to that team 
- The active filter should show when its selected so users can tell which requirement and/or user they are filtering by 
- Only The Font sizes must be consistent to the design found here, which is 14px. [https://app.zeplin.io/project/5dc457eace302d23dce64377/screen/5e4dc84b9305357f90bf1fb6](https://app.zeplin.io/project/5dc457eace302d23dce64377/screen/5e4dc84b9305357f90bf1fb6)

YH5LGtAZW0KjHP0pShCU.author: LCu96CcgYjQz7tEYOi5J1CfMwIv2
YH5LGtAZW0KjHP0pShCU.description:
Overview
--------

A core value proposition of Tara is to help software teams build predictable plans so they they can deliver software on time according to plan. In this requirement, we describe the first iteration of the functionality to help teams build more predictable sprint plans.

Main User Goal
--------------

Planning a sprint is a shared responsibility of the Product Owner and Team Lead. The

Core user story
---------------

As I\'m putting the next sprint\'s plan, I want to know whether if I\'m potentially overloading the sprint before it starts, so that there is a higher likelihood of having all the tasks delivered as committed.

[Design:](https://zpl.io/V0m8Jmo) [https://zpl.io/V0m8Jmo](https://zpl.io/V0m8Jmo)[](https://zpl.io/V0m8Jmo)

**Details**

1.  As a user adds tasks to any upcoming sprint, there is an indicator on the sprint column that lets the user know if that sprint is likely getting overloaded.
2.  The threshold is calculated based on the total efforts of all completed tasks averaged from **up to** the last 3 sprints. For example, if the total efforts completed from the last 3 completed sprints are 15, 23, and 18 respectively, then the average total efforts across those sprints would be 19. For a new org, the user will get this indicator as soon as there is one sprint completed.
3.  The user can get more details about how the recommended threshold is calculated, and the past sprint data that support that calculation.
4.  At the time a sprint starts, we\'ll embed the recommended threshold into that sprint, so that we can preserve the threshold data for that sprint. We will keep track of whether the recommended threshold was honored based on whether the sprint was overloaded.
5.  User will see a modal containing sprint plan summary, and an overload indicator if appropriate, just as s/he starts the sprint

Out of scope
------------

*   Telling the user that a sprint could be overloaded when a user changes a task\'s effort estimate in the Requirements page

Acceptance
----------

1.  In the sprint planning page, as a user is loading a sprint, the effort estimate should show/hide overloading indicator as tasks more moved in and out of the sprint
2.  The overload indicator should show/hide as efforts for an individual task in that sprint change
3.  In an active sprint, a user should still see the overload indicator (if the sprint was overloaded) as of the time when the sprint started
4.  If a completed sprint is deleted, the overload threshold should update for upcoming sprints
5.  When we navigate to a completed sprint, we should see the threshold that was recommended at the time that sprints started and whether the sprint plan was overloaded or not based on that threshold, not the current threshold which could be different
YH5LGtAZW0KjHP0pShCU.title: Sprint Plan Overload Indicator

YeAvOqJTDGtWC2KsOErr.title: iOS mobile app
YeAvOqJTDGtWC2KsOErr.description:
Mobile App Objective(s)
-----------------------

First, your PRD requires you to describe what you want the product to do, as well as the core objectives of the product. For the first version of any mobile app, it’s recommended to focus on a single problem your target users are experiencing. By concentrating on a core problem, it’s easier to create a concise product vision for the mobile app and establish precise success metrics.

What is Your Product Vision Statement?
--------------------------------------

A vision statement defines a clear direction towards the end goal of the mobile app. On top of that, a vision statement describes the solution to the problem your intended users are facing. In your vision statement, you need to include who the product is for, what the user is trying to accomplish, how the product will solve the user’s pain points, and how the product is different from competing apps in the market.

YecHacc8wPee3BHjvcQf.author: 7PVaq3IAtSh9fwMMdyQZ7Cp0Fm33
YecHacc8wPee3BHjvcQf.title: App Funnel and Event Tracking
YecHacc8wPee3BHjvcQf.description:
**Fullstory Tracking**

We currently have user sessions that get synced into fullstory but need to pass further information like emails in fullstory to easily troubleshoot user issues. Fullstory has something called FSidentify that is used to track users by sending some properties into it. You can read more about this here [https://help.fullstory.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020828113](https://help.fullstory.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020828113). There is also a react package I’ve used before that can be found here [https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-fullstory](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-fullstory).

Fullstory code snippets can be found here [https://app.fullstory.com/ui/T6P99/settings/general](https://app.fullstory.com/ui/T6P99/settings/general)

All we need to send to Fullstory is the logged in users:

*   Email
*   Org Name
*   User Role collected on onboarding (Engineer, Product Manager, etc)

**GA Tracking**

In order to clean up our user sessions we need to be sending a uniqueID that generated from Firebase into Google Analytics so that we can filter out our person UserID’s from being read into the analytics and retention tracking. More about User Properties can be read here [https://firebase.google.com/docs/analytics/user-properties](https://firebase.google.com/docs/analytics/user-properties)

A user property by the name of UserID already exists on firebase analytics. We would also like to pass a few more properties into Firebase Analytics which are below:

*   Org Name
*   User Role collected on onboarding

The properties are already set up here [https://console.firebase.google.com/u/1/project/tara-cloud/analytics/app/web:YzJlZDI2NzMtNDgxZS00NzA0LTlkZDktZDZlYTBiOWRjYWQ5/userproperty/~2F%3Ft%3D1588885036912&fpn%3D255175073335&swu%3D1&sgu%3D1&sus%3Dupgraded&cs%3Dapp.m.userproperties.overview&g%3D1](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/1/project/tara-cloud/analytics/app/web:YzJlZDI2NzMtNDgxZS00NzA0LTlkZDktZDZlYTBiOWRjYWQ5/userproperty/~2F%3Ft%3D1588885036912&fpn%3D255175073335&swu%3D1&sgu%3D1&sus%3Dupgraded&cs%3Dapp.m.userproperties.overview&g%3D1)

**Why do we need to track the above?**

We are tracking these properties to set up a wide segmentation for the start and will later start logging events into GA so we can use these properties as filters.

dxFCbRZFKDdXPGCgJ1Q6.description:
**Overview:**
-------------

Firebase does not provide an option for maintaining Snapshots. As a result, we have to find a solve for doing the same.

Implementation:
---------------

Create Sub collections Inside each collection to maintain revision history of that collection :

1\. Create revisions as a sub-collection under \`**/orgs/{orgId}/sprints/{sprintId}/revisions**\`

2\. Create revisions as a sub-collection under \`**/orgs/{orgId}/requirements/{requirementId}/revisions**\`

3\. Create revisions as a sub-collection under \`**/orgs/{orgId}/tasks/{taskId}/revisions\`**

*   Each of the sprints, requirements and the tasks document are maintained as a complete document for every update on the same
*   Each document follows a strict type with default value if not provided(TBD) -> Currently we do not have strict type so the updated document will be sparse and can be type strict eventually.
*   Every task/sprint/requirement even if had existed before will reflect the changes and will have future snapshots, However it will not be able to maintain any logs until then.

ehPRwkk9ck4O0IaYelDV.title: GitHub improvement Q4 2020
ehPRwkk9ck4O0IaYelDV.description:
**Overview**

GitHub integration is a very strategic feature. By bringing engineering activities into Tara tasks, Tara provides information about where "real" progress is.

​

Our existing GitHub integration functionality has the basic pieces. However, there are a few missing features that limit the value of this integration. In addition, there are a few areas that are causing usability issues. Here, we describe changes designed to improve overall user experience in setting up and maintaining the integration.

​

**Requirements**

In order of priority

1. ++Update task and sprints view to show git info++. While a user can link git data to a task today, the application doesn\'t surface it up in the places where they can be valuable - e.g. Sprint Progress page. They are also hidden in the bottom part of the task modal. The git data serve as additional insights about progress, so they should be upfront and prominent. Design: (https://app.zeplin.io/project/5d82bd8c15ade554f8e9e1c2/screen/5f7507a44e969c459f2613c5)
2. ++Import report.++ We should inform users import stats - how many records (issues, PRs) were found, how many were imported or discarded, how many tasks were created, etc. This is basic import functionality that is needed to give users the confidence that our import works well. (Design: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5d82bd8c15ade554f8e9e1c2/screen/5f6ce6ba0a4f334ca67623e4)
3. ++Define import limits++. Let user know how many records can be handled
4. ++Show import progress++. Improve progress bar to give users a sense of progress. Users have reported that the integration sometimes appear "stalled", and they don\'t know if there was an error or it simply took a long time. (Design - WIP: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5d82bd8c15ade554f8e9e1c2/screen/5f6cd7e56c86b388950a367b)

​

Why are we making these enhancements?

- Number 1 is the key value props for integrating with GitHub and other source control
- The rest are table stakes in making the import robust.

​

**Questions & Considerations**

1. Q: How\'s the situation with GitHub admin versus non-GitHub admin trying to initiate the integration? Is that still clunky?
2. Q: In a PR\'s lifecycle, can a PR be re-opened? A: Yes, and when that happens, we should move the task back from Done to Doing
3. Q: How should repos be shown and organized on the backlog?
4. Q: How do we handle statuses/substatuses beyond To Do, Doing, Done?
5. Q: Can we capture deployment information on a task? Is it possible to do this in a lightweight way if we support one set of tools (e.g. our own set) A: some of the information is already embedded in the data we import today. We should
6. Q: What\'s the opportunity to incorporate support for GitLab integration if we expose an API? A: Syed / Bobby to come back with details on the different approaches
7. Q: About standardizing the git-task linkage based on branch, can we infer branch/commits if the linkage is via a PR?

​
ehPRwkk9ck4O0IaYelDV.author: LCu96CcgYjQz7tEYOi5J1CfMwIv2

ezDuWVfAXLULXBZ3lCEq.description:
![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Frequirements%2FezDuWVfAXLULXBZ3lCEq%2Fimage-1c4e9f92-38cd-429f-9276-1bb73e79c73e.png?alt=media&token=f07b4a94-73ba-4b68-814c-0c9a86a9a96d)

​

**Data we need to save in the backend:**

- subscriptionType (String) - Premium or Co-Pilot
- subscriptionDuration (String) - Monthly or Annual
- subscriptionStart (Timestamp) - Subscription start date [Initially Null, only populates once Stripe has successfully processed the payment)
- subscriptionEnd (Timestamp) - Subscription End Date [Initially Null, only shows if a user cancels a subscription)
- subscriptionNextBilling (Timestamp) - This is the date either 1 year or 1 month from the subscriptionStart date, this date is also used to trigger payments in stripe.
- subscriptionActive (Boolean) - Is the subscription active or inactive, this is used to show the badge to upgrade to users
- subscriptionSeats (Number) - This is the total number of users in the workspace to bill and is used to initiate the bill amount on the subscriptionNextBilling
- subscriptionSeatsAdd (Map or Array) - Contains the seats purchased on a set day, this updates and keeps records everytime a new seat is added. Let say a user initially purchased 8 seats in July, in August they invite and add a new user, this array or map saves that data and runs a prorated payment from the day the seat was added to the subscriptionNextBilling Date.

​

​

We would need the ability to dynamically update seats and bill, so if a user gets added lets say after they get early billed we will manually take care of it in stripe.

hOVVIPAo5BPYqDzQoVRR.description:
Figma link: [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=2485%3A32264](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=2485%3A32264)

Dropbox document: [https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/xowabem0o71k9744wn3ab/Task-Sidepanel.paper?dl=0&rlkey=qeu9ftdaqrk81wa565n6fwptg](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/xowabem0o71k9744wn3ab/Task-Sidepanel.paper?dl=0&rlkey=qeu9ftdaqrk81wa565n6fwptg)

​

## General Logic

**1. URL logic**

1a. When single clicking on a task card the URL must append with `#active={taskId}`

​

## Task Header

**1. Task Number**

1a. Task number is static/non-editable

1b. Color and bar color should match the status

​

**2. Task Status**

2a. Clicking status will change the task status

2b. The Task Status selector will be the same component from 2.x. No changes.

​

**3. Task Story Points**

3a. Story Points is editable.

3b. Story Point have a min value of 0, max of 99

​

**4. Task Assignee**

4a. Assignee opens assignee dropdown

4b. No multi-select, only single select

4c. When not assigneed, show the default people icon

4d. Users in the assignee popup must be listed in alphbetical order by first name for all users on the workspace.

4e. Clicking on a user will close the assignee popup and update the task assignee.

​

**5. Task Title**

5a. Tasks title is editable.

5b. On clicking on task edit, reuse the task creation box component (alpha pod)

5c. The task edit field must use Draft with the assignee, estimation & labels plugins

5d. Charater Limit - max limit is 500. If the text is more than one line it will wrap to show all of the task title.

5e. Editing UI - use the same component to edit the UI that Alpha has for editing the sprint description. (@see Sprint Details Sidebar - Edit Sprint Info: [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=994%3A0](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=994%3A0))

​

**6. Tags / Labels**

6a. Labels will have a clear background and blue text

6b. Labels are not currently inline and will NOT be inline for 3.0 alpha

6c. Labels will NOT have any data structure changes nor UI changes for 3.0 alpha

​

++**Out of Scope:**++

**• No functionality changes to the labels**

​

Q: Need **edit UI for the task title.** @tara-user-UMevbsG6aHSeeSQCy3BTMGTFwhj1

​

​

## Task Summary

**1. Task preview**

1a. Only the first 300 letters are shown.

1b. When decription goes over max length use an ellipsis at the end.

1c. DraftJS will be in a read-only mode.

1d. ++**Out of Scope**++. No styling customizations. We just use a read-only Draft editor.

​

**2. Task Labels**

2a. Labels in the task title or task description are listed.

2b. Labels are listed in the order they are added to the task. Not alphabetical.

2c. Labels must only be a single line.

2d. Any labels that can\'t be fully rendered should not be displayed and the end space should have a pill with the total number of labels not should.

2e. Clicking on the not-shown label is out of scope.

2f. Clicking on any of the labels will set the page-level filter.

2g. Labels do not have a hover state nor a selected state. They will always have a clear background w/ blue text.

​

++**Out of scope**++

• Clicking on the not-shown element (like +3) is out of scope.

​

**3. Open in Define Button**

3a. Link to open in define mode. The URL is the same as it is today `{org}/{team}/tasks/{taskId}`

​

++**Out of scope**++

**• No styling customizations to Draft editor display for task summary.**

​

​

## **Collaborators**

**1. General**

1a. The component max-height will increase to show all collabotors.

1b. Collaborators will be displayed in the order added to the task.

1c. Pills will wrap to the next line until all are displayed.

1d. Max charater length for a pill is 30 charaters. Longer will show an ellipsis.

1e. Implement the UI for the plus and optional right-aligned text in the design-system.

​

**2. Empty State**

2a. The empty state will have the plus button with text on the right that says "Add a collaborator"

​

**3. Adding User**

3a. Clicking the plus will open the assignee popup.

​

**4. Removing User**

4a. Clicking a pill will remove the user.

4b. ++**Out of Scope**++: There is no hover state or alternate state to inform the user that clicking will remover the user.

​

++**Out of Scope**++

1. No hover state for the user pill.

​

​

## **Subtasks**

**1. General**

1a. Ordering - Subtasks are ordered byt the parent task\'s orderedTaskIds property.

1b. Charater Limit - Max limit is 500 characters.

1c. Charater display limit - When displaying (not editing) subtask titles over 100 characters will have ellipsis.

1d. ++**Out of Scope**++++:++ Subtask can not be dragged to a sprint from the side panel; only from the work drawer.

1e. ++**Out of Scope**++: Subtasks do NOT show if they are part of a sprint or not in this view.

1f. Hover state - If no user is assigned to a subtask, on hover a transparent plus button should appear where the assignee is.

​

**2. Creation**

2a. Use the Create Task Box that Ralph has built.

2b. The create subtask will use Draft and have plugins for estimation, assignee and story points active.

2c. Instead of using the full UI, make a condensed inline version that looks like the input field in the Figma designs

2d. On creation, subtasks will be defaulted to the task assignee.

​

**3. Deletion**

​

**4. Editing**

4a. Clicking on the text will switch that task to the create task box in condensed mode (no UI and single line only)

4b. Clicking the checkbox will toggle the status between "todo" & "done"

4c. Clicking on the assignee bubble icon or the plus button in a hover state will open the assignee popup to change the assignee.

​

Q: Need **Create new task **UI. (Can we use the teir 1 creation inout from the work drawer?) @tara-user-UMevbsG6aHSeeSQCy3BTMGTFwhj1

Q: The checkbox interface makes a subtask go from \'todo\' directly to \'done\'. Is that ok? @tara-user-UMevbsG6aHSeeSQCy3BTMGTFwhj1

​

​

++**Out of Scope**++**:**

**•** **No reordering on task.**

**• Subtasks can be added to a sprint from the work drawer but are NOT dragable from the task side panel.**

**• Subtasks do NOT show if or what sprint a subtask is on.**

​

## **Git Status**

**1. Disconnected State**

1a. When not connected to anything in git, static text will be displayed to educate the user on how to connect the task to git.

1b. After a task is connected this state will not be shown.

​

**2. Connected State**

2a. After connected to at least one git object it will show the connected state.

2b. Only one item will show as being connected, even if it\'s connected to multiple git objects.

2c. When a PR is connected, the PR name is show.

2d. When a branch or commit is connected, but no PR, show the branch that\'s connected to.

2e. Hovering over anywhere the connected state will show a tool tip with instructions on how to connect to git.

2f. Only show the first PR or branch that gets connected

​

++**Out of scope**++

**• Do NOT show multiple git items connected**

​

​

## Commenting

**1. General**

1a. > 500 - If the last comment is over 500 charaters then only the lat comment. Truncate any comment over 500 charaters

1b. < 500 - If the last comment is under 500 charters show the last 2 comments and truncate to 250.

1c. All formatting in the comment will be shown.

1d. ++**Out of Scope**++: Editing is out of scope.

1e. The new UI for comments is not built yet. Just make this UI as is. It might or might not align with the editable version of commenting.

​

**2. Comments**

2a. Comment UI is read only.

​

**3. Define Button**

3a. Clicking the define button is the same action & route as we have today. `/{org}/{team}/tasks/{taskId}`

​

++**Out of scope:**++

• No threading or resolve/open UI until after we design the commenting upgrades.

• Editing comments inline is out of scope.

​

## **Activity**

**1. Activity**

1a. No change in the functionality or data source for the activity

1b. Only show the most 5 recent items. Never show more than the 5 most recent.

1c. The blue text is **not** clickable. It\'s just styling.

1d. Reuse the same UI component for Sprint side panel. (Ask Alpha Pod)

1e. Activty 3.0\'s feature set IS downscoped from 2.x. We will have less features. That is ok.

​

++**Out of Scope**++

• Nothing in activty is clickable

• 3.0 Activity has less features than 2.x. That is fine. We are downscoping the Activity feature set.

(Kevin Fogarty/Reuters)By Matt Zapotosky and Devlin Barrett Feb. 11, 2020 at 9:35 a.m. PSTThe Justice Department plans to reduce its sentencing recommendation for longtime President Trump confidant Roger Stone, after top officials were apparently blindsided by the seven-to-nine year penalty prosecutors urged a judge to impose, a senior Justice Department official said Tuesday.In a stunning rebuke of career prosecutors that will surely raise questions about political meddling in the case, a senior Justice Department official said the department “was shocked to see the sentencing recommendation in the Roger Stone case last night.”“That recommendation is not what had been briefed to the department,” the official said. “The department finds the recommendation extreme and excessive and disproportionate to Stone’s offenses. The department will clarify its position later today.”Roger Stone deserves 7 to 9 years prison for lying to Congress in Russia probe, U.S. says in sentencing recommendation for Trump confidantThe statement came hours after President Trump tweeted of the sentence prosecutors recommended, “This is a horrible and very unfair situation. The real crimes were on the other side, as nothing happens to them. Cannot allow this miscarriage of justice!” The senior Justice Department official, though, said the decision to revise prosecutors’ recommendation came before Trump’s tweet.ADStone was convicted by a jury in November of lying to Congress and tampering with a witness. His was the last conviction secured by special counsel Robert S. Mueller III as part of his investigation of Russian interference in the 2016 election.Stone has been a friend and adviser to Trump since the 1980s and was a key figure in Trump’s 2016 presidential campaign to discover damaging information on Democratic opponent Hillary Clinton.As Monday’s court deadline neared for the prosecutors to give a sentencing recommendation for Stone, it was still unclear what the office would do, after days of tense internal debates on the subject, according to people familiar with the matter.Front-line prosecutors, some previously from Mueller’s team, argued for a sentence on the higher end, while their bosses wanted to calculate the guidelines differently to get to a lower prison sentence. The debate centered around whether they should seek more prison time for obstruction that impedes the administration of justice, these people said.ADIn the end, the office filed a recommendation in keeping with the line prosecutors’ goals, and rejecting the lighter recommendation sought by their superiors, the people said.Hours before the filing was due Monday, the new head of the D.C. office, interim U.S. attorney Timothy Shea — a former close adviser to Attorney General William P. Barr — had not made a final decision on Stone’s sentencing recommendation, according to the people, who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss internal deliberations.Disagreements among prosecutors about sentencing recommendations are not uncommon, especially when it comes to politically sensitive high-profile cases. It would have been unusual, however, for the U.S. attorney’s office to endorse a sentence below the guideline range after winning conviction at trial, according to former federal prosecutors.ADIn a 22-page filing, prosecutors Jonathan Kravis, Michael J. Marando, Adam C. Jed and Aaron S.J. Zelinksky wrote that a sentence of 87 to 108 months, “consistent with the applicable advisory Guidelines would accurately reflect the seriousness of his crimes and promote respect for the law.” Leaving a hearing in federal court in Washington, Jed and Kravis declined to comment.Stone’s defense on Monday asked for a sentence of probation, citing his age, 67, and lack of criminal history. They also noted that of seven Mueller defendants who have been sentenced, only one faces more than a six-month term: former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort, who is serving 7½ years.Given the hardships and loss of professional standing suffered by Stone and his family, “No one could seriously contend that a [reduced . . .] sentence would cause anyone to walk away from these proceedings believing that one can commit the offenses at issue here with impunity,” defense attorneys Bruce S. Rogow, Robert C. Buschel and Grant J. Smith wrote.ADFederal guidelines typically call for a sentence ranging from 15 to 21 months for first-time offenders convicted of obstruction offenses, such as lying to Congress, making false statements and witness tampering, as Stone was.The range ratchets up steeply, potentially to more than seven years in prison, if the offense involves other factors such as threatening physical injury or property damage to a witness; substantially interfering with the administration of justice; or the willful obstruction of justice. Each was cited by prosecutors.A seven- to nine-year term “will send the message that tampering with a witness, obstructing justice, and lying in the context of a congressional investigation on matters of critical national importance are not crimes to be taken lightly,” prosecutors wrote.Spencer S. jmXS7TX6GJzKJoGnNBMU.description:
# Overview

This requirement captures the redesign of the Sprint Plan page. The new layout anchors the new designs for the entire Tara app moving forward. The primary goals are to:

1. resolve some of the core navigational issues in the existing app (e.g. hard to find a newly created task in the backlog)
2. eliminate suboptimal use of space and layout (e.g. too much space for 2 sprint columns)
3. let user access more relevant information with fewer clicks (e.g. see sprint details without requiring someone click on submenus to access modals
4. tighten the UI patterns across pages and making them link up more seamlessly (e.g. having a work drawer than anchors all pages to have a sense of unity across app)

​

## Core Use Cases

The core use cases for the new sprint planning pages remain the same as our current app. The page is primarily let a product manager (PM) or engineering manager (EM) plan the upcoming sprints.

​

User stories

1. As a PM, I want to be able to add tasks to the upcoming sprints so that the engineering team will know what to work on.
2. As a PM, I want to order the tasks from high priority to low, so that the team knows which ones are the most important pieces of work to get done.
3. As an EM, I need to assign the tasks to the appropriate engineers and balance the work across the team, so that they can be most productive but also not overloaded.

​

## Designs

lQ6rjR2JC5QH5Y9MM6a8.title: Task id to slug performance refactor
lQ6rjR2JC5QH5Y9MM6a8.author: JM1rJtbXFaPcQ6cqF734u54MqGa2
lQ6rjR2JC5QH5Y9MM6a8.description:
**TaskID / slug RFC**

**Overview**

The task id should be replaced by the unique task slug
**Problem**

Currently, our router uses the task slug which in some cases creates the need to make serialized query calls which hinders performance.
**Solution**

In order to improve app performance and simplify fetching data throughout the app the task id should be replaced by the unique task slug and the task slug field should be removed everywhere. By setting the tasks unique slug as the id the url query param can be used to fetch additional resources in a parallelized manner.
I**mplementation**
• Update create a task to set slug as task id
• Write migration to create new tasks with slug set as id
– Consider batching migration as to not overload cloud functions
– if migration is done update create task webhooks to not trigger during migration

• Update routing table to only use new task id slug
**Migration**
The migration will involve putting the app into maintenance mode for approximately thirty minutes while we export and recreate tasks.
Steps

1.) Put the app into maintenance mode by disabling UI and blocking all security rules.
2.) Run DB backup
3.) Push pr that disables all triggers.
4.) Delete each task and create a new task with the slug as the id. (make sure there is logic to retry from the latest doc on failure.)

5.) Delete each git summary and replace it with a new summary with the correct slug ID.
6.) On successful run push pr enabling UI, triggers, and security rules.

ndk2p3TyIfeNc0RLgjOH.author: 7PVaq3IAtSh9fwMMdyQZ7Cp0Fm33
ndk2p3TyIfeNc0RLgjOH.description:
Slate has been consistently crashing for the past few days. Since our release went out on May 15th the Slate editor has been causing a wide range of issues which make the app crash when creating and editing requirements. Some of these have been very hard to replicate since they get triggered by different interactions.

**Some of the errors that we\'ve noticed so far:**

1.  Error: Cannot resolve a DOM point from Slate point: {"path":\[27,0\],"offset":153} at Object.toDOMPoint (About 32 instances caught so far, users in the US and abroad)
2.  toDOMPoint@https://app.tara.ai/static/js/2.c0e3ea39.chunk.js:2:295678/ntoDOMRange@https://app.tara.ai/static/js/2.c0e3ea39.chunk.js:2:295827 (Newly caught error today with 3 users so far)

**Replicating these errors has been tough but here are some ways that you can make it show up.**

*   Typing a full paragraph of text continuously and then editing it for mistakes. So any natural typing flow can eventually end up crashing the app.

*   The quickest way I\'ve noticed to crash the editor is by adding styling to text and selecting text and adding styling and then switching the styling. So a piece of selected text can be made into H1 then H2, then bold and italic and so on so forth.

**What we\'ve tried so far:**

*   Adding a try catch to the component to catch errors on isDirty and when the data saves, we didn\'t catch any errors there.

Downgrading the slate versions, as they got bumped up on Friday the 15th, so going back to 0.57.1 for all slate dependents. This fix is in production but we were still able to crash the editor.

**Probable causes:**

*   The cursor support is messed up when data is being streamed
*   The data streaming is heavy on the browser memory and its causing an uncaught memory leak
*   Bad state management on data saves and reads

*   `some text sfsdf`

# Tara Orchestrator: Deployments (version + env)

++**Goal: Connect an inital feature request until code hits production.**++

​

Capturing deployment is the last data piece to have a complete lifecycle of a feature request. Teams all have custom deployment scripts in their CIs. It\'s impossible to capture those details. Instead we focus on the proxy. All teams use Git artifiacts to describe to the CI where/when to deploy code. The most common versioning/deployment mechanisms are are `branches` and tags. For the initial feature we will not support all permutations but only the most common for a survey of our user base, branches. The key is to not just have the version but also the environment that version is live in.

​

Deployment has 3 peices: Semantic version number, repo->app & the environment.

​

- Branches named master, development & main are excluded from deploy environments.
- Github Marketplace apps do have offical deploy API connected.
- Connected vs Custom Deployments.

​

# Deployments

## ​

Github Deployments API has these features that let us create and manage domain artifacts [https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos)

- Deployments (Create Get List Delete Inactive)
- Deployment Statuses (Create Get List)

​

From a Tara user\'s perspective, we will manage steps 2 and 4 of this use case.

​

#1. Deployment (only if user has a custom CI). CI starts by sending a deployment event.

#2. Webhook will be trigged when the deployment is created.

[https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#deployment](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#deployment)

​

#3. Deployment (only if user has a custom CI). CI creates deployment\_status

#4. Webhook recieves deployment\_status

[https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#deployment\_status](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#deployment_status)

​

**TODO:**

- **What data structure do we need to save for a Github "Deployment" and "Deployment Status"?**
- **How will we link together, a PR\'s commit history, when a commit is squashed via the PR process?**

​

Github Actions for deployments already trigger the REST API calls. If a CI wasn\'t installed from Github the user would need to send the 2 API calls (create deployment & create deployment status) themselves. Tara will just listen for webhooks on Github for deployment events.

​

## #1. **Deployment (only if user has a custom CI).** CI starts by sending a deployment event.

[https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#create-a-deployment](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#create-a-deployment)

​

curl \

-X POST \ -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \

-u your\_username:your\_personal\_access\_token \

[api.github.com/repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments](https://api.github.com/repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments) \

-d "{\'ref\': \'branch, tag, or SHA.\', \

\'environment\': \'production\', \

\'deploy\_user\': \'some-user\', \

\'description\': \'desc\'}"

returns

{

...

"created\_at": "2012-07-20T01:19:13Z",

"updated\_at": "2012-07-20T01:19:13Z",

"statuses\_url": "[api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/1/statuses](https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example/deployments/1/statuses)",

"repository\_url": "[api.github.com/repos/octocat/example](https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/example)",

...

}

​

## #2. **Webhook** will be trigged when the deployment is created.

[https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#deployment](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#deployment)

{

"action": "created",

"deployment": {

"url": "[https://api.github.com/repos/Codertocat/Hello-World/deployments/145988746](https://api.github.com/repos/Codertocat/Hello-World/deployments/145988746)",

"id": 145988746,

"sha": "f95f852bd8fca8fcc58a9a2d6c842781e32a215e",

"ref": "master",

"environment": "production",

"description": null,

"creator": {...},

"created\_at": "2019-05-15T15:20:53Z",

"updated\_at": "2019-05-15T15:20:53Z",

"repository\_url": "[https://api.github.com/repos/Codertocat/Hello-World](https://api.github.com/repos/Codertocat/Hello-World)" },

"repository": {...},

...

}

​

## #3. **Deployment (only if user has a custom CI).** CI creates deployment\_status

[https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#create-a-deployment-status](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#create-a-deployment-status)

​

curl \

-X POST \ -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \

-u your\_username:your\_personal\_access\_token \

[https://api.github.com/repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment\_id}/statuses](https://api.github.com/repos/{owner}/{repo}/deployments/{deployment_id}/statuses) \

-d \'{"state":"error | failure | inactive | in\_progress | queued | pending | success"

"environment": "some-name",

"environment\_url": "..."}\'

Response Status: 201 Created

​

## #4. **Webhook** recieves deployment\_status

[https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#deployment\_status](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#deployment_status)

"On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains."

oZXGm0DPuBYrjKmaJXfC.title: Page Loads under 2.5s
oZXGm0DPuBYrjKmaJXfC.description:
# Goal: Every page must load in under 2.5 seconds.

​

There are two areas of performance. Page Load and CPU Load. Page Load is CRITICAL. CPU load is not.

​

## CRITICAL: Slow Page Loads

Slow page loads are because we load firestore data in phases. After a full assessment of the app, the amount of data load is fine but the phasing of loads kills us.

​

**The Problem:** To see the problem open dev tools, go to the performance tab, and record the page loading. Open up the timings group and look at the chunks of queries loading. Right now there will always be one for the user doc, one for the org+users, and another for page specific loads.

​

1. **Data Architecture**:** **Documents that require multiple referential lookups must be refactored. Git data is an example of bad architecture. It was designed for an RDB but doesn\'t work for NoSQL. Any document that requires multiple lookups needs to be refactored to load give only data that\'s available in the page\'s URL.
2. **React Architecture**: The problem with our React structure is that we have deeply nested components that trigger their own queries. But higher components skip rendering until its own data is ready. There are multiple options to explore to correct this architecture issue. We can pull up query dependencies up the stack, or still render all components but not let them render until data is ready or only allow pages to load data. We\'ll have to define what to do as a group.

​

**Priorities:**

\* Git/Task relationships (commit-task, pull-request-task, branch-task) needs to have all displayable data queryable by task-slug

\* Comments need to be queryable by task-slug id

​

Bad 4 Phase load example on Sprint Planning.

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Frequirements%2FoZXGm0DPuBYrjKmaJXfC%2F4-phases-4d7cac97-43d4-4438-b8a1-fd194403c856?alt=media&token=a1b54e58-2bc0-413e-83ee-92d011bf0c0a)

​

Improved 2 Phase load on Sprint Details.

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Frequirements%2FoZXGm0DPuBYrjKmaJXfC%2F2-phases-aea2b39c-ead2-4b62-8f28-fa8ba778c0ab?alt=media&token=bcfdbc46-db53-40b1-bfe8-cdcb9c0731c5)

​

# CPU Load

CPU Load is basically just over-rendering. It\'s a waste but it doesn\'t impact the users in the majority of cases. We must fix page loads before addressing CPU Load issues.

​

options to rework performance:

1. Pass Partials as props
2. Pass selectors as props and `useSelector` hooks will trigger isolated re-renders

​

**Priorities:**

\* Sprint Planning Page

\* Task Modal
oZXGm0DPuBYrjKmaJXfC.author: 0ZpXmyPNYbWhd7yL4yM5oPfwoxn2
