p8UyTYILZlynyzkWoOhv.title: Text Editor POC
p8UyTYILZlynyzkWoOhv.description:
The aim of this requirement is to outline the items needed to be done for the text editor POC.

**The text editor should have the following basic functionality.**

A basic editor toolbar with Bold, Italics, Underlining

The ability to copy and paste text (Plain text copy and paste support, you can strip any formatting on paste if needed)

The bullet points do not working correctly i.e a double enter doesn\'t exit bullet point styling, you have to click on the bullet point icon in the toolbar to switch it off

Code block styling is non-existent, even after you select the code block from the editor toolbar it doesn\'t format correctly

*   Attachments

*   Ability to select text easily with no cursor jumps
*   Undo functionality

*   Markdown support using Github Markdown
*   Auto-save is necessary
*   Most Importantly Well Documented and Easy to implement
*   No cursor skipping and easy text selection and editing

**Current Issues in Slate that are commonly Reported by Users:**

*   The cursor skips when highlighting text
*   The cursor placement when editing text is inaccurate

**Editors that solve some issues our users face really well:**

Basic Editor with a good Render Engine [https://draftjs.org/](https://draftjs.org/)

Extensibility of Draft and other projects built on Draft [https://github.com/nikgraf/awesome-draft-js](https://github.com/nikgraf/awesome-draft-js)[](https://draftjs.org/)

List of Draft Js Plugins [https://github.com/draft-js-plugins/draft-js-plugins](https://github.com/draft-js-plugins/draft-js-plugins)[](https://draftjs.org/)

[](https://draftjs.org/)Full featured editor with support for formatted copy pasting and tables [https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/)

Most popular out of box editor with good react support [https://www.tiny.cloud/](https://www.tiny.cloud/)[](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/) and [https://www.tiny.cloud/blog/how-to-add-tinymce-5-to-a-simple-react-project/](https://www.tiny.cloud/blog/how-to-add-tinymce-5-to-a-simple-react-project/)

pW9ja67LHq5TTAJcSQGI.description:
## **Overview**

**Goal:** A PoC to learn/show how we would link code development activities with Tara tasks to provide end-to-end visibility into the task progress and status

**How**

Automatically link imported git data - commits/PRs/branches - to Tasks when messages reference a Tara task ID (e.g. TASK-23461).

**Important Note**

This iteration should be considered PoC only. The goal is to get to the point where we can see the git information in the task object as quickly as possible, so that we can learn from this linkage and iterate on it.

## **Details**

**Requirements**

1. Show the commits/PRs/Branch information/GitHub links in the Task detail. It can be just a simple list similar to what appears in the commits/PR tables today.
2. Support many-to-many mapping: If a branch/commit/PR serves multiple tasks, we will link it to multiple tasks. If a task is linked to multiple branches/PRs, we\'ll show all of them in the same task.
3. Feature-flagged. This should be available for Tara-ai org only until further notice. We should have a way to toggle on/off this feature on the UI without redeployment, so that we can show/hide the git information in the task detail easily
4. See attached image for a prototype concept. Note that the image does not reflect what we will eventually roll out to users when we productize the feature. It merely shows the feature-flagged section where we can "dump" the git data
5. If an engineer only enters the TASK ID in one of the three - either the branch name, a single commit message, or a PR title, the system should find the linkage of the other entities and show them on the task. For example, if the engineer only enters a TASK-ID in a single commit message, Tara should link the proper branch/PRs to that task. Note: if there\'s any discrepancy - for example the commit message says TASK-123 but linked PR has TASK-456, then both TASK-123 and TASK-456 should the linked branches/commits/PRs.
6. Get environment information - where a task is deployed - based on how Tara as an org has set up our deployment infrastructure.

**Assumptions**

1. Individual engineers will be responsible for manually adding the task IDs to 1) commit messages, 2) PR title, and 3) Branch name when creating branch/commits/PRs.
2. We will build to our own set up in this iteration, meaning we are conscious of the fact that the way we implement this may not work for other Git/GitHub configurations, especially to get deployment information.

## Acceptance

1. We should be able to show/hide this new section without redeployment
2. This new section is only shown for tara-ai org. None of the other orgs should see this section.
3. When a user opens task modal or task detail page, the user should see the list of branches, commits, and/or PRs that are linked to the task via the TASK-ID (see attached file for the mock)
4. If a message/title has multiple TASK-IDs, we should see that information in the respective tasks

Reference doc about tracking releases in different environments:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VbUSPQTA5O0rw3yxiJQkyKcGpg4-f-fJUoSodmASGeM/edit#](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VbUSPQTA5O0rw3yxiJQkyKcGpg4-f-fJUoSodmASGeM/edit#)

Refinement:

[https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Github-Task-Lifecycle--Ay7ZyG2SuMfnKfmsCHQwemmLAg-rCDG9xeZ5z6lgeGJApDzY](https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Github-Task-Lifecycle--Ay7ZyG2SuMfnKfmsCHQwemmLAg-rCDG9xeZ5z6lgeGJApDzY)

pYQebTAwnoPyuLGVy3Td.description:
Goal
----

Have a proper, systematic way of controlling features/sub-features that are being released to different orgs, and later the down the line, different users

Context
-------

We\'ve had issues implementing and controlling the feature flags for various features that we have rolled out. (e.g. Github/Slack). This requirement is about fixing these issues, making controls of who gets a feature or not super simple

Example Use Cases
-----------------

1.  Launch a feature in production for internal use or internal testing: e.g. initial Slack integration (as of this writing) should be accessible only by tara and gradberry orgs currently
2.  Keep an older version of a feature live for customers while releasing a new version to be tested either internally, or externally by selected orgs, or even selected users within selected orgs: e.g. keeping an older version of the sprint insights for most users while releasing a new version for some users (similar to A/B/C... testing)
3.  Globally switching off a feature in case of an emergency

Ideal Requirements
------------------

1.  A PM or a business person can control the flag
2.  It should not require re-deployment
3.  Controls can be at the org level, user level (within an org), and team level (when we implement team concept)
4.  Should be flexible enough to control most features/sub-features per definition of PM
5.  The same feature flagging controls can be used for subscription-based access (if/when we decide to do so)

qo3awWPSm2djdOTSMBdq.description:
## Overview

As teams continue to grow with Tara, the number of tasks will increase. Having a way to quickly categorize and find tasks is essential to keeping Tara efficient. Here, we capture the requirements for the "Label" feature - allowing a user to tag tasks with labels.

​

Background research on tags/labels and general organization of tasks is: [here](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/10Mf-BSYslghcvuQyh6ZdaX1VB7l6mVXPlCO--SyhOTc/edit#slide=id.p) (Ping @derek to chat more if you have questions).

​

## **Solution**

The high-level solution is as follows:

1. We will leverage a user\'s hashtag inputs on task titles and descriptions as a way of tagging tasks
2. We will provide "standard" labels that behave like attributes rather than free-text labels. These include task types, priorities, and severity.

​

## Designs

Here is the link to the designs: https://zpl.io/beQPBdp

Dropbox Paper: https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Labels--BD~edFpOYYe6BVIkHiOeGrJuAg-qTP59woPBouMTgGmHUq4E

​

## Requirements

A. Adding a label to a task

1. User types a hashtag (#) as a way of denoting a label. (e.g. #critical) #hashtag will be recognized in title and description
2. As user types, the system provides some suggested labels - the system ones plus those that have previously been added.
3. User can also create a new free-text label that can be shared with the rest of the workspace.

​

B. Modification

1. User should be able to remove or modify labels on a task with the text editor

​

C. Label types

1. Task type: feature, bug, enhancement
2. Priority: p1, p2, p3
3. Severity: sev1, sev2, sev3

​

D. Format

1. All labels will be kept in lower case

​

## Questions

1. ​

​

## Out of scope

In this iteration, the following are out of scope

1. Adding labels to requirements
2. Adding labels to comments
3. Modification of "standard" labels
4. Label management

​

## Acceptance

1. A user should be able to add labels via hashtags on the task title and task description
2. A user should be able to remove labels from a task
3. A user should be able to create new free-text labels
qo3awWPSm2djdOTSMBdq.author: LCu96CcgYjQz7tEYOi5J1CfMwIv2

rZVDTfbBv6uWQYDZLiWg.description:
# Define Mode

​

Figma link: [https://www.figma.com/file/zhMwS4Vd9sR5ptd9F16imR/Define-Mode?node-id=107%3A0](https://www.figma.com/file/zhMwS4Vd9sR5ptd9F16imR/Define-Mode?node-id=107%3A0)

## General

## 0. Engineering setup

0a. Rename the requirement list to \`Legacy\_xxx\`.

0b. Use the NEW\_SPRINTS\_PAGE feature flag. Rename to TARA\_TWO.

0c. The page should not display until all data needed to define the state is loaded.

0d. ++**Out of Scope**++: All commenting UI is out of scope. Both read and write UI/actions will be handled in a different requirement.

## **1. URL**

1a. **Preserve session state**. When the user click on the define tab the workdrawer and selected requirement MUST be in the same state as it was previously.

1b. **Tab button hold URL state**. The editor must have the same requirement open when clicking back from other tabs.

1c. **Schema**. The URL for define is both `/requirements/${id}` & `/tasks/${id}`.

​

## **2. Workdrawer state**

2a. **Per-tab state**. When filters & opening/closing Teir 1 are tab specific. (So the app has 3 seperate states for the work drawer; define, sprint, progress)

2b. **Session persistence.** Tabbing back will reflect the same state.

2c. **Default data loaded**. On load we should fetch all active (non-archieved / non-deleted) requirements and display all Tier 2 items but no Tier 3 items. All Tier 2 items should be in a closed state.

2d. **Default state:no requirements**. When the workspace has no requirement, show the default/welcome text.

2e. **Default state:no active**. If the user types in the url with no active state, redirect to the first requirement (see 2f).

2f. **Default state:requirement**. When loading a requirement from a fresh state (URL: `requirements/${id}`)

• The selected requirement must load in a open state showing all task cards in the workdrawer.

• The selected requirement should be in a selected state. (blue border)

• The draft editor should have display the requirment description.

• All other tier 2 items are closed by default.

2g. **Default state:task**. When loading to a task from cold boot `tasks/${id}`.

• open the Teir 2 parent owner of the task and show all children (This will be sequential. Load all requirement + active task, then load all other task in the active requirement)

• Put the Tier 3/Card for the task in a selected state. (blue border)

• Show the task description in the draft editor.

• All other Tier 2 items should be closed.

​

## 3. Workdrawer creation

3a. **Action timing**. New requirement is created when hitting enter, click the blue accessory icon on the right or on input blur.

3b. **Cancel creation**. HittiCng delete with no characters exits creation mode with nothing created.

3b. **Creation: no text**. If no text is in the input when commited then cancel.

3d.** Post-creation**. The instant a new requirement is created it should be set to active. That mean showing the editor, side panel.

​

++**Out of Scope**++: For beta tab state will NOT preseve on refresh; ie no local storage.

++**Out of scope**++**: **Not templates.

​

## 4. Workdrawer selection

4a. **Tier 2: single click.** Single click will select the requirement. Which means:

• A blue highlight will show up around the Tier 2 element.

• On Define page, the Draft editor shows the requirment details

• On Define page, the URL changes to `requirements/${id}`

• ++**Out of scope**++: On Define page, the side panel will NOT change. (Once commenting is done we\'ll show the comments in the side panel.)

• On the Sprint page, the URL will change `?active=${requirementId}&type=requirement`.

• On the Sprint page, the side panel will show the requirement side panel. (Only the title, first 400 characters of the description & a view in define mode button.)

4b. **Tier 2: clicking on triangle.** Clicking on the triangle will allows toggle open/close for the requirement. It does NOT change selection of the element.

4c. **Tier 2: double click.** Double clicking will toggle open/close of the tree component. This will show/hide the tasks.

4d. **Tier 3/Card: single click.** Single click will select the task. Which means:

• A blue highlight will show up around the Tier 3/Card element.

• On Define page, the URL changes to `tasks/${id}`

• Draft editor shows the task details

• On Define, side panel will be the task side panel.

• On the Sprint page, the URL will change `?active=${taskId}&type=task`.

• On the Sprint page, the side panel will show the task side panel.

4e. **Tier 3/Card: double click.** No double click action.

​

## 5. Workdrawer filters

5a. **Sprint Filters**. On cold boot in Sprint mode the filters should default to:

• Sprint Tasks - off

• Team Requirements - off

• Archieved Requirements - off

• Tasks Done - off

5b. **Define Filters.** On cold boot in Define mode the filters should default to:

• Sprint Tasks - on

• Team Requirements - on

• Archieved Requirements - off

• Tasks Done - on

5c. **Work Drawer only.** The workdrawer filters affect the workdrawer but not the sprint columns.

5d. **Pre-tab filters.** When a user changes a filter it should keep those toggles for that page.

• If a user navigates away and then back the filters should remain the same.

• On page refresh the filter reset to the default.

​

++**Out of Scope:**++ No local storage for saving state for the 2.0 alpha.

​

## Requirement Side Panel

**0. Engineering note.**

0a. Requirement side panel ONLY shows on the Sprint page. On Define mode the side panel will always show comments.

++**Out of Scope**++: Comment side panel will be done in another story.

​

**1. Requirement Header**

1a. **Editing.** Single click on the requirment title switches to the edit input.

1b. **No Teams assigned. **When no teams are assigned to a requirement the selector will show a "draft" state.

1c. **Team Selector Dropdown**. Clicking the team selector will show the team dropdown. The dropdown is mutli-select.

1d. **Multiple Teams.** When assigned only the first team will be displayed. If multiples are selected than show a "+n" with a count of the other teams.

1e. **Team Button: max length.** Anything over 15 characters will show an ellipsis at the end.

1f. **Last updated.** Last updated shows the creatros name and the relative time.

​

**2. Requirement Desciption Preview**

2a. **Max length:** Description will only show the first 400 characters.

2b. **Labels length.** Labels will be a single line below the description. Any labels that dont fit on a single line will show "+n".

2c. **Clicking Label.** Clicking a label will change the global filter.

2d. **View in Define button.** Clicking view in Define mode will navigate to `requirements/${id}`.

​

​

## Editor

**1. Empty State**

1a. When no Requirement is selected or created show the welcome text.

​

​

**2. Features**

2a. ++**Out of Scope**++: no new features.

2b. **Font sizes**. Increase the base font size to 16pt. H2 is 16pt. H1

2c. ++**Out of Scope**++: no changes to inline image layout

2d. ++**Out of Scope**++: no new task card view

2e. **Draft editor width**. The width of Draft editor in requirments should have fix pixel width that allows for 80 characters, monospaced on a block qoute to fix.

​

**3. Toolbar**

3a. ++**Out of Scope**++: Tool bar does not add any new features.

3b. When archieved, a red bar is shown at the top allowing users to restore or delete.

3c. **Share**: The share button with just copy the link for alpha. (++**Out of scope**++: Later we will add true sharing features similar to a Google doc.)

3d. **Scrolling - toolbar**: The toolbar will stay on the top when scrolling. When scrolling the content just under the scroll bar will have a slight opacity fade.

​

## Team Selector

**1. All teams**

1a. The define page is not team specific. On the define page the team selector should say "All Teams" and it is NOT interactive.

​

rmX7TWxCMjykFIh4fNGy.title: Autojoin by Email Removal
rmX7TWxCMjykFIh4fNGy.description:
Currently users that join tara from domains that are not present in the public domains collection get added to the same org. There are thousands of throw away, educational and organizational emails that would need to be added into the collection to offset the issues.

So users for example with a throwaway email like 20minutemail.com or a student from rmit.edu for whom the TLD did not exist in the public domains collections, the email joinable code will automatically add them into a single org. This gives users access to data thats not theirs and brings forth a big data privacy issue.

By removing the Autojoin by domain we would stop the above from happening. What this would do is that for every signup regardless of what email TLD they used the user would end up created a new org.

**What this will not support is multi org access, so every first signed up user that creates an org who does not come through an invite will be linked to a single org.**

**Items to consider:**

We should also consider showing an on screen error for users that are trying to 1) invite themselves or users to an org when the invitee already has an org existing with that email
rmX7TWxCMjykFIh4fNGy.author: 7PVaq3IAtSh9fwMMdyQZ7Cp0Fm33

rt2SftcCuzDh3hD0wznJ.author: u83CGZwusdaS32hkaTjThNrASeA3
rt2SftcCuzDh3hD0wznJ.description:
Mobile App Objective(s)
-----------------------

First, your PRD requires you to describe what you want the product to do, as well as the core objectives of the product. For the first version of any mobile app, it’s recommended to focus on a single problem your target users are experiencing. By concentrating on a core problem, it’s easier to create a concise product vision for the mobile app and establish precise success metrics.

What is Your Product Vision Statement?
--------------------------------------

A vision statement defines a clear direction towards the end goal of the mobile app. On top of that, a vision statement describes the solution to the problem your intended users are facing. In your vision statement, you need to include who the product is for, what the user is trying to accomplish, how the product will solve the user’s pain points, and how the product is different from competing apps in the market.

uchPe1jAahQ0Cq9e2hjv.description:
Our current text editor slate has unfortunately been very limiting and we plan to switch it over with a paid solution in order to bring in some table stake text editor features. The plan is to switch over to Froala [https://froala.com/](https://froala.com/) . The first phase to replace the text editor once Andrew tests and finds it viable to do so. The second phase is to safely sanitize and migrate data over.

**Why are we switching Text Editors Again?**

Our current text editor is missing much of the requested features that our users have asked for, these include link copy pasting, retaining styling after pasting, getting rid of buggy cursor movements. Secondly we have spent a good 3 months on trying to get slate to work the way we intend it to work. The slate editor is definitely extensible but the open source support has been slow moving and navigating the slate API has been a major challenge.

**Is this solution future proof?**

From all the documentation that I\'ve read so far, I can assure you that its very future proof and that paying for the solution also gets us the support we need if any questions do arise. It even has the ability to support multiple languages, it has its own set of paid plugins that allow real time text editing.

**What are the limitations of the Froala Editor?**

The current limitations are that it doesn\'t support Markdown out of the box, in my initial testing I was unable to get it to retain all styling when markdown was parsed into the editor. Second thing is that it doesn\'t support real time collaborative editing i.e you cant see another person type on the editor without another service that is sold as a plugin. We may also have to implement a save button as I\'m still unsure of auto save functionality.

*   No Markdown support out of the box
*   May require a save button
*   Data save format is different from slate
*   No real time collaboration without a 3rd party plugin

**Plan of Execution**

**Phase 1:**

*   Test the open source version of the editor in a secluded branch or inside storybook. Ensure that the editor does not produce console errors, saves data accurately, test the editor API and asses how easy it is to switch features on and off. Finally do a save data diff, compare the data save from Froala to Slate and document it.
*   If it passes the criteria above, delete the test branch and transfer usable code into a new branch and start building for a merge into development branch.

**Phase 2:**

*   Backend Migrations need to be written to help sanitize data that slate has produced so that it will show correctly inside the froala text editor.
*   We also wrote some code that translates git markdown into slate markdown and that may need to either be deprecated or updated.
*   Test for data integrity and ensure no bad data goes through the editor into the back end

**Implementation Risks**

Replacing a shared component thats used widely across the platform brings in high risk. We will have to plan some safe guards around how to mitigate data loss, potential breakages in the production environment. This section will be updated for Rollback and Mitigation steps.

**Quick Links to Documentation:**

Overview of Features: [https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/tour/](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/tour/)

API Options, Methods and Events [](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/tour/): [https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs/options/](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs/options/)

Usage of Froala with React : [https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs/framework-plugins/react/](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs/framework-plugins/react/)

Using Type Definitions with Froala: [https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs/framework-plugins/react/#using-type-definition-file](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs/framework-plugins/react/#using-type-definition-file)

Froala Demos : [https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/examples/](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/examples/)[](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs/framework-plugins/react/#using-type-definition-file)[](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs/framework-plugins/react/)[](https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/docs/options/)

vGKAeinXZeGji8uSUOcC.title: Labels & Search Refinements
vGKAeinXZeGji8uSUOcC.description:
The following refinements should be implemented in order to fine-tune the experience that users are having with our recently released label and search feature.

​

Items are listed in priority order.

​

1. Performance:  The task modal seems to be particularly affected, but I think we need to do a general performance assessment as a result of landing this feature if we haven\'t already.  This is by far the highest ticket item on this list.
2. Refinement:Limit the visible results of a search to only the results (hide rather than lowering opacity) for cards that do not contain the search term. _Rationale: Several users have reported that they only want to see the returned results and if we don\'t even allow them to double-click into cards that are shown but not selectable, then why show them at all?_
3. Enhancement: Add labels that have been added to the text editor within the array that is searched. It appears that currently, only labels placed into the task title are searchable.  _From the user perspective: Why allow labeling in the text editor if it\'s not being searched?_
4. Refinment: Make it more clear that a filter is in place by adding a blue highlight around the search box and the X which cancels it out.  Only canceling out the current search removes the blue highlight by hitting the X or by selecting the copy in the input box and deleting it.The affordance we give for found results "1 found" should also be in a more visible color.  It\'s barely visible now.

​

​

​

​

@tara-user-nUee72pVi1Qb5OPwjGNgI9G4uX12 and @tara-user-o4yyzJztJzg546ggMrWBjMX2dyw2

## Support a notification ecosystem for emails, web and in app notifications

​

### In App Notifications

- Write a document into a global notifications collection, with a list of users to send it to
- When user views a notification, add their document reference to an array of \`read\`

​

### Web Notifications

- When a notification document is created, a trigger calls a function to send a FCM? or otherwise web notification
- [https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/tara-cloud-dev/notification](https://meet.google.com/linkredirect?authuser=0&dest=https%3A%2F%2Fconsole.firebase.google.com%2Fu%2F0%2Fproject%2Ftara-cloud-dev%2Fnotification)
- [https://firebase.google.com/docs/cloud-messaging/js/client?authuser=0](https://meet.google.com/linkredirect?authuser=0&dest=https%3A%2F%2Ffirebase.google.com%2Fdocs%2Fcloud-messaging%2Fjs%2Fclient%3Fauthuser%3D0)

​

### Email Notifications

- When a notification document is created, a trigger calls a function to send emails
- Refactor the existing subscriber trigger to trigger from the notifications collection instead

xyKeu2itONZKyF7tVN5x.description:
## Overview

This requirement captures the implementation of filters in the Sprint pages - Sprint Planning and Sprint Progress views - so that it is easier for a user to find the tasks associated with a requirement or a user.

## Design

1. Filtering in the Sprint Planning page: (Preliminary) [https://zpl.io/amN9d06](https://zpl.io/amN9d06)
2. Filtering in the Sprint Progress page: (Preliminary) [https://zpl.io/adGBJ1K](https://zpl.io/adGBJ1K)

## **Sprint Planning Page Filter**

- **Use case:** provide a product manager an easy way to see how tasks from a requirement is spread across multiple sprints as s/he sequences the project
- **UX**: when a user clicks into a particular requirement in the backlog column, the tasks associated with that requirement across all columns - backlog and sprints - should be highlighted. This applies to "Task Backlog" as well, where the tasks not associated with any requirement will be highlighted

## Sprint Progress Page Filter

- **Use case**: provides an engineering leader focus on tasks associated with the high priority requirements, or being done by specific developers (assignees)
- **UX**: a user selects a filter (e.g. a requirement), tasks associated with a requirement is highlighted

44.title: [Sprint Overload] (backend) Add previous and next fields in sprint
44.description:
Overview

A core value proposition of Tara is to help software teams build predictable plans so they they can deliver software on time according to plan. In this requirement, we describe the first iteration of the functionality to help teams build more predictable sprint plans.

Core user story
---------------

As I\'m putting the next sprint\'s plan, I want to know whether if I\'m potentially overloading the sprint before it starts, so that there is a higher likelihood of having all the tasks delivered as committed.

[Design:](https://zpl.io/V0m8Jmo) [https://zpl.io/V0m8Jmo](https://zpl.io/V0m8Jmo)[](https://zpl.io/V0m8Jmo)

Detail Requirements

1.  As a user adds tasks to any upcoming sprint, there is an indicator on the sprint column that lets the user know if that sprint is likely getting overloaded.
2.  The threshold is calculated based on the total efforts of all completed tasks averaged from **up to** the last 3 sprints. For example, if the total efforts completed from the last 3 completed sprints are 15, 23, and 18 respectively, then the average total efforts across those sprints would be 19. For a new org, the user will get this indicator as soon as there is one sprint completed.
3.  The user can get more details about how the recommended threshold is calculated, and the past sprint data that support that calculation.
4.  At the time a sprint starts, we\'ll embed the recommended threshold into that sprint, so that we can preserve the data for that sprint. We will keep track of whether the recommendation was honored based on whether the sprint was overloaded.
5.  User will see a modal containing sprint plan summary, and an overload indicator if appropriate, just as s/he starts the sprint

Out of scope
------------

*   Telling the user that a sprint could be overloaded when a user changes a task\'s effort estimate in the Requirements page

Acceptance
----------

1.  In the sprint planning page, as a user is loading a sprint, the effort estimate should show/hide overloading indicator as tasks more moved in and out of the sprint
2.  The overload indicator should show/hide as efforts for an individual task in that sprint change
3.  In an active sprint, a user should still see the overload indicator (if the sprint was overloaded) as of the time when the sprint started
4.  If a completed sprint is deleted, the overload threshold should update for upcoming sprints
5.  For a completed sprint, we shall see the stats in the sprint details page, including the overload indicator if plan was overloaded.

259.title: March 23rd Check List for Production Release
259.description:
This checklist is intended to improve the release process. All engineers who have worked on back-end or front-end functionality that impacts the below parts of our platform **MUST** contribute to this form by end of day Monday every week.

**Feature Flags**
Any feature flags that need to be turned on or turned off. Please mention the name of the feature flag that matches to its name in firebase and its status like shown below. True means the item is feature flagged and false means no longer feature flagged

- Feature Flag Name [TRUE]

**Migrations Needed**
Any migrations that were added and have to be ensured that they run for this release. Please add the name of the cloud function as it appears in your google cloud console and the trigger in brackets. 

- Name of Cloud Function [TRIGGER] 

- 

**Cloud Function Deployments**
Any new or updated cloud functions that need to be put into production and have to be running in order for the production environment to be functional. 

- 

- 

**Updates to Env Variables**
Any new or updated env variables for the upcoming release that need to added to build scripts. Please add the name of the variable and the status. Please do not share sensitive keys in this ticket. 

- Name of Env Variable [NEW,UPDATED,REMOVED]

- 

**Any other scripts, libraries or packages that need updating in production**
Were any new scripts added or removed, new packages created on npm that need to be handled on the production release. While `Yarn` takes care of all of this, sometimes there are items that have to be bought to our attention. 

- Name of Package, Script, etc Updated and why is it worth mentioning here. 

- 

**Any Tests that are missing or failing consistently**
If there are tests that are missing which will make production break or failing consistently but the build needs to be put into production, these exceptions must be stated here with a reason to why we should still push the release or hold the release. In any case this area will hopefully always be empty. 

- Name of Failing Test. What does this Test do? Why should we overlook this test or why should this test hold up production?


**Misc Issues that we may encounter with this build**
Are there any issues you are aware off that may break the production build. If so, are there solutions or hotfixes in progress for this. Please mention those below. 

- What is the issue related to? Cloud function, build script, tests, UI/UX, etc. What do we expect to see when this issue occurs? Error Message, Console Log, Stack Driver Log, Broken Image, Etc. 

- 

### Production Release Check List

- [ ] We have ensured all cloud functions needed for the release are functional 

- [ ] We have ensured all migrations run without failing 

- [ ] We have checked that there are no build errors

- [ ] We have checked that the site works on our local environment with no new errors

- [ ] We have checked that all tests are passing

1046.title: March 23rd Check List for Production Release
1046.description:
This checklist is intended to improve the release process. All engineers who have worked on back-end or front-end functionality that impacts the below parts of our platform **MUST** contribute to this form by end of day Monday every week.

**Feature Flags**
Any feature flags that need to be turned on or turned off. Please mention the name of the feature flag that matches to its name in firebase and its status like shown below. True means the item is feature flagged and false means no longer feature flagged

- Feature Flag Name [TRUE]

**Migrations Needed**
Any migrations that were added and have to be ensured that they run for this release. Please add the name of the cloud function as it appears in your google cloud console and the trigger in brackets. 

- Name of Cloud Function [TRIGGER] 

- 

**Cloud Function Deployments**
Any new or updated cloud functions that need to be put into production and have to be running in order for the production environment to be functional. 

- 

- 

**Updates to Env Variables**
Any new or updated env variables for the upcoming release that need to added to build scripts. Please add the name of the variable and the status. Please do not share sensitive keys in this ticket. 

- Name of Env Variable [NEW,UPDATED,REMOVED]

- 

**Any other scripts, libraries or packages that need updating in production**
Were any new scripts added or removed, new packages created on npm that need to be handled on the production release. While `Yarn` takes care of all of this, sometimes there are items that have to be bought to our attention. 

- Name of Package, Script, etc Updated and why is it worth mentioning here. 

- 

**Any Tests that are missing or failing consistently**
If there are tests that are missing which will make production break or failing consistently but the build needs to be put into production, these exceptions must be stated here with a reason to why we should still push the release or hold the release. In any case this area will hopefully always be empty. 

- Name of Failing Test. What does this Test do? Why should we overlook this test or why should this test hold up production?


**Misc Issues that we may encounter with this build**
Are there any issues you are aware off that may break the production build. If so, are there solutions or hotfixes in progress for this. Please mention those below. 

- What is the issue related to? Cloud function, build script, tests, UI/UX, etc. What do we expect to see when this issue occurs? Error Message, Console Log, Stack Driver Log, Broken Image, Etc. 

- 

### Production Release Check List

- [ ] We have ensured all cloud functions needed for the release are functional 

- [ ] We have ensured all migrations run without failing 

- [ ] We have checked that there are no build errors

- [ ] We have checked that the site works on our local environment with no new errors

- [ ] We have checked that all tests are passing

1047.title: Move to paid TLS certificates
1047.description:
Currently using a combination of Let\'s Encrypt and CloudFlare shared certs. We should get a single cert for the following:

- app.tara.ai
- *.app.tara.ai

We should continue to use Let\'s Encrypt for branded subdomains (ibm and mower) unless there is a contractual requirement.

the purpose of this task is to ensure that the Intercom button which currently appears throughout the application is available in two places:

b) on the internal pricing page which the user can reach by clicking on the "Premium" button in the global nav

4205.title: After deleting a task, jump to the next task directly after the one that just got deleted
4205.description:
When we delete a task, we should not show the information for that task in the task details panel.

​

what we currently do is delete the task and load the sprint information.

​

what we want to do is to load the next task.

​

this logic should apply to both sprint columns and the work drawer

​

​

​

If it\'s the last task in the folder or the requirement, just load the requirement (if you\'re in define mode) and if you\'re in sprint mode, load the sprint information.

also see the next task:

​

to see what the behavior should be when we delete a task

4253.title: [#tara-label-monetization] Hard gate for future sprints
4253.description:
Update the firestore rules block free users from creating sprints when tara 2.0 flag is on for their workspace. Only the firebase-admin will create sprints for free users.

​

Premium users will still be able to create sprints.

​

Make sure to update the firestore.rules tests and ensure that auto-sprints will still work.

​

This is just part of the paywall level 1 work: [https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/tasks/3951](https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/tasks/3951)

We need to track when a user opens the app for any reason. So we will save it in their user document so that it\'s doesn\'t go through Google Analytics (which is blocked by ad blockers).

​

1. Add a new optional field to the user document called \`lastViewed?: Timestamp;\`

2. In the tools/library/firestore.ts onLogin dispatch an action to set lastViewed to \`[::serverTimestamp]\`

​

4329.author: 0ZpXmyPNYbWhd7yL4yM5oPfwoxn2
4329.description:
​

​

We need to take the selected Task/Sprint/Requirement and move it into Redux instead of passing it down through props.

[15:56](https://taraai.slack.com/archives/DTM7D37KQ/p1626379016003900)

That value is the biggest cause perf issues when clicking the next/previous on sprint columns.

[15:58](https://taraai.slack.com/archives/DTM7D37KQ/p1626379100005600)

We are passing it down as a prop when it changes. That causes all of those components to be marked as dirty in react. So it runs the render function but the result is that no DOM needs to be update in anything except the task card getting deselected and the one getting selected.

[15:59](https://taraai.slack.com/archives/DTM7D37KQ/p1626379147006400)

So if it’s in redux then only the 2 tasks that change will be marked as dirty and be queue in react for a render check.

​
4329.title: [#tara-label-P1] [#tara-label-performance] [#tara-label-sprint-columns] move selected document to Redux

4357.description:
When a user creates a workspace we need to add one requirement and 7 tasks to be created in their workspace as well. This will serve as a tutorial to allow users to understand the key features of Tara 2.0.

​

Export getting started docs:

- Requirement ([https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Frequirements~2FYawnwgVcpVKh0hjhIWkx](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Frequirements~2FYawnwgVcpVKh0hjhIWkx))
- Task-1 [https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F18](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F18)
- Task-2 [https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F19](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F19)
- Task-3 [https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F20](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F20)
- Task-4 [https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F21](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F21)
- Task-5 [https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F22](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F22)
- Task-6 [https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F23](https://console.firebase.google.com/project/tara-cloud-dev/firestore/data/~2Forgs~2Fjune-fifteenth~2Ftasks~2F23)

​

1. Update the author, updatedBy, creation fields to be tara-bot (aka null)
2. Creation/updated times should be dynamic when the document is created.
3. Ensure the requirement.orderedTaskIds are in the correct order.
4. Ensure the images are accessible by all workspaces

​

Make sure these getting started documents are added to the NodeJS backend when a workspace is created.

4371.author: 0ZpXmyPNYbWhd7yL4yM5oPfwoxn2
4371.description:
Task details and requirement details URLs need to be unchanged when the user is on 2.0. When the workspace\'s `newSprintsPage` feature flag is on the URLs for the details pages include \'/define\'. We need to remove that.

​

Task/Requirement detail pages should be the same URL but show different views whether a workspace is on the new 2.0 or not. 

​

We will be doing a phased rollout so both 1.0 and 2.0 should work properly. Once everyone is on 2.0 we\'ll delete the old code. 

​

task url should be: `/{workspaceId}/{teamId}/tasks/{taskId}`

requirement url should be:` /{workspaceId}/{teamId}/requirements/{requirementId}`
4371.title: [#tara-label-P2] Unify details URLs for 2.0 & 1. 0
